groups.name: Content
groups.description: Requirements related to the substantive content of the articles.

requirements.description: An article should start with a clear definition in the lead section.
requirements.reference: The first sentence of the lead should define what the scope of the article is.

requirements.description: The lead section should summarize the most important points of the article.
requirements.reference: The lead should summarize the most important points of the article.

requirements.description: The article should include a history section if the topic has a significant historical aspect.
requirements.reference: Include a history section if the topic has a significant historical aspect.
requirements.when: Applicable when the topic has historical significance.

groups.name: Formatting
groups.description: Requirements related to the visual and structural formatting of the articles.

requirements.description: Use level 2 headings for main sections.
requirements.reference: Use level 2 headings for main sections.

requirements.description: Avoid using bold text for emphasis.
requirements.reference: Avoid using bold text for emphasis.

requirements.description: Use italics for the titles of works such as books and films.
requirements.reference: Use italics for the titles of works such as books and films.
requirements.when: Applicable when mentioning titles of works.

groups.name: Language Usage
groups.description: Guidelines for the appropriate use of language, including gene nomenclature and abbreviations.

requirements.description: Human gene names should be written in all capitals.
requirements.reference: Human gene names are written in capitals, for example ALDOA, INS, etc.

requirements.description: Avoid jargon and technical terms unless necessary.
requirements.reference: Avoid jargon and technical terms unless necessary.

requirements.description: Use consistent terminology throughout the article.
requirements.reference: Use consistent terminology throughout the article.

groups.name: Citations
groups.description: Requirements for citing sources and references within the articles.

requirements.description: All statements that are challenged or likely to be challenged should be supported by a citation.
requirements.reference: All statements that are challenged or likely to be challenged should be supported by a citation.
requirements.when: When statements are challenged or likely to be challenged.

requirements.description: Use inline citations for direct quotes.
requirements.reference: Use inline citations for direct quotes.

requirements.description: Prefer reliable sources such as peer-reviewed journals.
requirements.reference: Prefer reliable sources such as peer-reviewed journals.

groups.name: Infoboxes
groups.description: Guidelines for the use and formatting of infoboxes in articles.

requirements.description: Include an infobox if it provides a useful summary of key facts.
requirements.reference: Include an infobox if it provides a useful summary of key facts.
requirements.where: At the beginning of the article
requirements.when: When key facts can be summarized.

requirements.description: Ensure infoboxes are consistent with the article content.
requirements.reference: Ensure infoboxes are consistent with the article content.

groups.name: Structure
groups.description: Guidelines for the overall structure and organization of the articles.

requirements.description: Articles should have a clear and logical structure.
requirements.reference: Articles should have a clear and logical structure.

requirements.description: Use subheadings to organize content within sections.
requirements.reference: Use subheadings to organize content within sections.

requirements.description: Avoid overly long sections by splitting them into smaller parts.
requirements.reference: Avoid overly long sections by splitting them into smaller parts.
